keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: The militants have alternated between terrorizing residents and courting them in their takeover of the ancient Syrian city.

headline.print_headline: ISIS Alternates Stick and Carrot in Captured City
headline.main: ISIS Alternates Stick and Carrot to Control Palmyra

snippet: The militants have alternated between terrorizing residents and courting them in their takeover of the ancient Syrian city.
abstract: Islamic State, in its capture of Palmyra, Syria, veers between terrorizing and courting residents of ancient city; militants seem to have put priority on establishing city as new outpost of its self-declared caliphate, rather than swiftly destroying or looting its Greco-Roman ruins.
